vista.graph
Class GraphicElement

java.lang.Object
  vista.graph.GraphicElement
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, Animate, Bounded, Drawable
Direct Known Subclasses:
AnimateElement, Curve, CurveLegendLine, Draggable, DSMGridElement, GEContainer, Grid, LineElement, Symbol, TextLine, TickLine
public abstract class GraphicElement
extends java.lang.Object
implements Drawable, Bounded, java.lang.Cloneable, Animate

This the base class for all graphic components. The design pattern followed here is the composite pattern. The GraphicElement is the Leaf of the heirarchy. All Drawable and Bounded elements are subclasses of this class. GEContainer is a subclass of this class which acts as a container for other GraphicElements.

This element has the responsibility of drawing itself in relation to a region and a graphics context. The graphics context used is java.awt.Graphics. This implements only the primitive functions required for drawing. A further update of this class may be needed when java.2d api is available.

Each such element and its subclasses have various settable attributes such as color, font, line thicknesses etcetra. These are all encapsulated in GEAttr objects and their subclasses. Access to these objects is provided via getAttributes and setAttributes functions

In addition to drawing itself this element contains its drawing size and parent reference. These are initialized and set by its parent classes or by the GELayoutManager classes. The elements preferred size is used in used in GELayoutManger to layout and size the elements.

For actual use of these elements they are encapsulated into a java.awt.Canvas object. This object then uses delegation for painting itself.

Version:
$Id: GraphicElement.java,v 1.1 2003/10/02 20:49:01 redwood Exp $
Author:
Nicky Sandhu

Drawable, Bounded, GEContainer, GELayoutManager, Graphics
